home.q1: Is there a minimum or maximum rental period for an ZüriCar GmbH van?
home.a1: The minimum rental period is half a day. The maximum rental period is generally 30 days. If you need a vehicle for longer than 30 days, please contact our Sales Team. We will gladly prepare an offer for you.
home.q2: Can I return the van at a different location?
home.a2: Yes, that is possible. Please contact us by phone at+41 79 766 99 60 for further information.
home.q3: Can I return the van abroad?
home.a3: No. Please contact your station directly for all details. Phone:+41 79 766 99 60
home.q4: Who should I contact if I experience issues with the vehicle?
home.a4: For general inquiries regarding your rented vehicle or rental agreement, please contact us at+41 79 766 99 60. If your vehicle breaks down and is no longer drivable, please contact our roadside assistance at the same number.
home.q5: Can I return the vehicle outside business hours?
home.a5: Yes, that’s no problem. If you return the vehicle outside opening hours, please park it in one of the available parking spaces at the ZüriCar GmbH station and drop the key in the key drop box. Please note that returning the key does not end your rental agreement. For more details, refer to your rental terms.
home.q6: Can I drive an ZüriCar GmbH van with a Category B driver's license?
home.a6: Yes, all vehicles are permitted for Category B license holders. The only requirement is that you’ve held your license for at least one year.
home.q7: I received a fine. What happens next?
home.a7: The fine is sent to ZüriCar GmbH. We identify the driver responsible and forward their details to the police or relevant authority. You will receive the fine directly from them. Additionally, we charge an administrative fee of CHF 80.00 (incl. VAT).
home.q8: What is included in the van rental rates?
home.a8: Our published rates include: service, liability insurance, comprehensive insurance (with deductible), theft protection (with deductible), vehicle tax, Swiss motorway vignette, winter tires (November–March), up to 150 free kilometers per day, and VAT. (Exceptions may apply for special corporate rates.)
home.a9: The total rental cost consists of the base rate (depending on vehicle category) plus the kilometers driven.
home.q10: I have a discount code – when can I use it?
home.a10: Please provide your discount code when making the reservation. It is not possible to apply a discount code after the rental has started.
home.q11: What currency are the rates in?
home.a11: All prices are listed in Swiss Francs (CHF) and include VAT.
home.q12: Are there additional costs for driving abroad?
home.a12: Yes, a Cross Border Fee (CBF) of up to CHF 185.00 (incl. VAT) applies. Please refer to the travel restrictions for each country and vehicle category in your rental agreement.
home.q13: Is there a liability reduction included?
home.a13: Yes, liability reduction is included in all rates (a deductible remains).
home.q14: What is the amount of the deductible?
home.a14: The deductible per damage case is CHF 3000 for categories O4, C4, and W4, and CHF 5000 for category H4. With the Premium Insurance add-on, you can reduce the deductible to CHF 500 per damage case.
home.q15: Is there a young driver surcharge?
home.a15: Yes, all drivers under the age of 25 must pay a young driver surcharge. Prices vary by category, with a maximum fee of CHF 199 per rental month.
home.a16: With Premium Insurance (liability waiver), you can reduce your deductible to CHF 350 per damage case, protecting you from high costs in case of loss or damage.
home.q17: How can I reserve a van from ZüriCar GmbH?
home.a17: You can reserve a van online at explorevacations.ch, by phone, or directly at an ZüriCar GmbH station.
home.q18: Are there additional costs for driving abroad?
home.a18: Yes, a Cross Border Fee (CBF) starting from CHF 185.00 (incl. VAT) applies. Please refer to travel restrictions in your rental terms for country-specific limitations.
home.q19: Can I rent a van for an extended period?
home.a19: Absolutely! If you need a vehicle for more than 30 days, please contact our Sales Team. We’ll be happy to prepare an offer for you.
home.q20: How far in advance should I book?
home.a20: We recommend booking as early as possible to accommodate your preferences for vehicle models, etc. Reservations are generally possible anytime up to shortly before the desired rental start.
home.q21: Can I reserve a specific vehicle model?
home.a21: You can reserve vehicle categories, but not specific models.
home.q22: Can I park my private car at the ZüriCar GmbH station during the rental period?
home.a22: Yes, this is generally possible at all our locations. However, please check availability with your specific station in advance. ZüriCar GmbH assumes no liability for any damage to your private vehicle.
home.q23: I noticed damage on the van before departure – what should I do?
home.a23: You must report any damage immediately. Please speak directly with a staff member at your pickup station.
home.q24: What should I check before starting my trip?
home.a24: For your own safety, please inspect the vehicle for any existing damage, adjust seat and mirrors, buckle up, switch on headlights, and ensure visibility through all windows.
home.q25: Can I request a test drive with assistance?
home.a25: Yes! With prior notice, an ZüriCar GmbH staff member will gladly accompany you on a short drive to help you get familiar with the van. Please contact your station in advance.
home.q26: Can I smoke in the van?
home.a26: No, all ZüriCar GmbH vehicles are non-smoking. Cleaning fees may apply in case of violation.
home.q27: What should I do if I’m involved in an accident?
home.a27: You’ll find a detailed checklist and documents in the glove compartment. Stay calm, secure the site, help the injured, and call the police (117).
home.q28: What if I can’t return the vehicle on time?
home.a28: Please plan enough time and extend your reservation in advance by contacting your station or calling+41 79 766 99 60. Late returns may incur fees.
home.q29: Can I return the vehicle earlier than planned?
home.a29: Early returns may result in rate adjustments and additional charges. Refunds are not possible.
home.q30: Can I return the vehicle later than planned?
home.a30: Unless you’ve received a confirmed extension, the vehicle must be returned at the end of your rental. Late returns will incur fees.
home.q31: Do I need to clean the van before returning it?
home.a31: We take care of cleaning, but kindly dispose of any trash and leave the cargo area broom-clean. Excessive dirt may result in additional cleaning charges.
home.q32: Do I need to refuel or recharge the van?
home.a32: Yes, please return the van with the same fuel level or charge as at pick-up. If not, additional refueling or charging fees may apply.

privacy.p1: ZüriCar GmbH ("we") is the data controller responsible for the collection and processing of your personal data in connection with its activities. Our mission is to provide our customers with a comprehensive range of travel services. In this Privacy Policy, we explain how we process your personal data and how you can control and manage it. Our data processing may be covered by further data protection notices, such as contained in particular in the General (Travel) Terms and Conditions, or may arise from the circumstances or be regulated by law. This Privacy Policy complies with the requirements of Swiss data protection law and, if and to the extent applicable, the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) of the European Union.
privacy.title1: ARE YOU AFFECTED BY THIS COMMUNICATION?
privacy.sub1: This Privacy Policy applies to you if you :
privacy.l1: are one of our customers or have a contractual relationship with us;
privacy.l2: are a fellow traveler of one of our customers.
privacy.l3: are interested in our products or services and therefore provide us with your personal data (e.g. in an agency, on our websites and apps or at events) so that we can contact you.
privacy.content1: If you provide us with other people's personal information, please ensure that you inform them about the sharing of their personal information and request that they read this Privacy Policy. We will ensure that we do the same whenever possible (e.g. where the contact details of the person concerned are available).
privacy.title2: HOW CAN YOU CONTROL OUR PROCESSING OF YOUR PERSONAL DATA?
privacy.sub2.1: You have rights that allow you to effectively control your personal data and the way we process it. Below we explain your rights in connection with your personal data.
privacy.sub2.2: If you wish to exercise the rights listed below, please submit a request by email to info@zuricar.ch or by post to the following address: Europa-Strasse 19 ,8152 Glattbrugg (ZH) Switzerland, Zurich, Switzerland.
privacy.sub2.3: If you have any questions about the use of your personal data under this Privacy Policy, please address them to the following address: https://zuericar.com/
privacy.l4: You can request access to your personal data
privacy.p4: If you believe that your personal data is inaccurate or incomplete, you may request that such personal data be amended or completed accordingly. In some cases, the submission of supporting documents may be required.
privacy.l5: You can request the deletion of your personal data
privacy.p5: You can object to the processing of your personal data on the basis of legitimate interests
privacy.l6: You can object to the processing of your personal data on the basis of legitimate interests
privacy.p6: If you do not agree to processing based on a legitimate interest, you may object on grounds relating to your individual situation. In this case, please inform us in detail about the corresponding processing and the reasons for your objection. We will stop processing your personal data unless there are compelling legitimate grounds or the processing serves to assert, exercise or defend legal claims.
privacy.l7: You can object to the processing of your personal data for direct marketing purposes
privacy.p7: You have the right to object to the processing of your personal data for direct marketing purposes at any time. This also applies to profiling, insofar as it is related to such direct advertising.
privacy.l8: You can request the restriction of the processing of your personal data
privacy.p8: If you contest the accuracy of the personal data we use or object to the processing of your personal data, we will review or revise your request. You can request that we restrict the processing of your personal data while we consider your request.
privacy.l9: You have rights against an automated individual decision
privacy.p9: In principle, you have the right not to be subject to a decision based solely on automated processing — including profiling — which produces legal effects concerning you or similarly significantly affects you. However, we may automate such a decision if it is necessary for the conclusion or performance of a contract with us, is permitted by law or if you have given your consent. In any case, you have the right to challenge the decision, to express your point of view and to request the intervention of a competent person with the review of the decision.
privacy.p10: In those cases where processing is based on consent you have given, you can withdraw this consent at any time.
privacy.l11: You can request portability of part of your personal data
privacy.p11: You may request a copy of the personal data provided by you in a structured, commonly used and machine-readable format. If technically feasible, you may request that we transmit this copy to a third party.
privacy.l12: Complaint to the Federal Data Protection and Information Commissioner
privacy.p12: In addition to the above rights, you can file a complaint with the relevant supervisory authority. In Switzerland, this is the Federal Data Protection and Information Commissioner (FDPIC), Feldeggweg 1, 3003 Bern.
privacy.p12.1: In this section, we explain the purpose for which we process your personal data and the legal basis for doing so. First and foremost, we use your personal data to execute a contract to which you are a party or to take pre-contractual measures at your request. However, we may also process your personal data in order to fulfil our legitimate interest or those of a third party.
privacy.p12.2: In particular, your personal data will be processed if it is necessary for the conclusion or performance of a contract in order to:
privacy.l13: conclude a (travel) contract with you. We may process personal data in order to register you as a new customer, enter into a contract, and perform it with you;
privacy.l13.1: provide you with products and services that you have purchased under the applicable Agreement;
privacy.l13.2: carry out billing, invoicing, and collection;
privacy.l13.3: provide you with services related to the preparation and implementation of a trip;
privacy.l13.6: to be able to provide assistance in case of difficulties during the trip if necessary;
privacy.l13.7: To provide you with access to our digital platforms. We may process personal data when you use our digital platforms for various purposes (e.g., to manage your personal information or to gain access to travel information);
privacy.l13.8: to provide access to our premises and facilities. We may process personal data when you visit us at our premises to carry out appropriate access and security checks;
privacy.l13.9: to communicate with you. We may process personal data if you wish to contact us, if you ask us for information about our company or services, or if the contract needs to be updated;
privacy.l13.10: Respond to your inquiries and assist you;
privacy.l13.11: manage the termination of the contract.
privacy.p14: Where we base a processing activity on a legitimate interest, we balance that interest against your interests or fundamental rights and freedoms to ensure that they are proportionate. As part of our business as a travel provider, we also use your personal data to:
privacy.l14.1: Improve cybersecurity, manage our platforms and websites, and ensure business continuity;
privacy.l14.3: Carry out maintenance of IT systems during operation;
privacy.l14.4: Improve the automation and efficiency of our operations and customer services (e.g., auto-populating complaints, tracking your requests, and improving your satisfaction based on personal information collected during our interactions with you, e.g., phone recordings, emails, or chats);
privacy.l14.5: Enable the assertion of legal claims and defense in connection with legal disputes and official proceedings;
privacy.l14.6: Organize contests, promotions, and conduct opinion polls and customer satisfaction surveys.
privacy.p15: If you are a customer and unless you object, we may send you offers for our products and services. We ensure that these commercial offers relate to products or services that are relevant to your needs and complement your already availed offers. You can object to this at any time.
privacy.p16: For certain processing of personal data, we will inform you specifically and ask for your consent. Of course, you can revoke your consent at any time.
privacy.p16.1: In particular, we ask for your consent for:
privacy.l16: The transfer of particularly sensitive personal data to third parties;
privacy.l16.1: Tailoring our offers and products or services based on a complex profile to predict your needs and behaviour;
privacy.l16.2: All electronic offers for products and services that are not similar to those you have purchased or for products and services from our trusted partners.
privacy.p17: If necessary, we may ask you for further consent to the processing of your personal data, but this will not affect any data processing that has already taken place.
privacy.h17: FOR WHAT PURPOSE AND ON WHAT LEGAL BASIS DO WE USE YOUR PERSONAL DATA?
privacy.h18: WHAT TYPES OF PERSONAL DATA DO WE COLLECT?

privacy.p19.1: Depending on the type of product or service we offer you and the interactions we have with you, we collect different types of personal data about you:

privacy.l20.1: Personal details, e.g. gender, birthday and age, marital status, nationality, passport details, etc.;
privacy.l20.2: Lifestyle, e.g. hobbies and interests, travel;
privacy.l20.3: Travel details, such as travel dates, itinerary/destination, airline, hotel, price, customer preferences, information about your travel companions, frequent flyer programs, etc.;
privacy.l20.4: Health data, e.g. details of health-related special needs or illnesses and accidents during a trip;
privacy.l20.5: Financial information, e.g., payment information, credit card number, bank account information;

terms.l25.12: In the case of long-term rentals (rentals with an agreed rental period of more than 25 days), the Hirer has an obligation to return the vehicle when the mileage stated in the rental agreement is reached, but no later than on the last rental day stated in the rental contract. general.p1.1: Preamble ZüriCar GmbH (hereinafter referred to as  ZüriCar GmbH) arranges travel services on the  info@zuricar.ch website. On this Internet portal, various travel services are offered by tour operators, airlines or other service providers named by name.
general.p1.2: The following terms and conditions of mediation apply to the brokerage services of  ZüriCar GmbH for package tours, cruises, flights (only), hotels (only), rental cars, city trips, other travel services, related travel services, and travel insurance on the internet portal.
general.p1.3: Please also note the applicable general terms and conditions (travel and payment conditions) as well as the pre-contractual information of the respective responsible provider, which you can view in the service description.
general.h2: I. Content of the Contract, Conclusion of the Contract
general.p2.1: A business management agreement is concluded between the customer and ZüriCar GmbH (hereinafter referred to as ' ZüriCar GmbH'). The customer commissions  ZüriCar GmbH to arrange package tours, cruises, a flight (only), a hotel (only), rental cars, city trips, other travel services, related travel services, and/or travel insurance from the respective service provider.  ZüriCar GmbH acts exclusively as an intermediary for the offered services and does not provide these services in its own name unless explicitly stated otherwise.
general.p2.2: The offers presented on the aforementioned portal do not constitute binding contractual offers by  ZüriCar GmbH or the respective service provider. By entering their data and submitting the online booking form to  ZüriCar GmbH, the customer submits a binding contract offer to the respective service provider and simultaneously commissions  ZüriCar GmbH to act as an intermediary.
general.p2.3: The customer will then receive an acknowledgment of receipt of the booking from  ZüriCar GmbH via email, sent to the email address provided by the customer. This acknowledgment merely confirms receipt of the booking request. The content of the booking confirmation is not stored and cannot be retrieved later.
general.p2.4: The customer is obliged to check the details in the booking confirmation for accuracy immediately upon receipt. If the information is incorrect, the customer must contact  ZüriCar GmbH immediately after receiving the confirmation using the phone number or email address provided on the portal to request a correction. Please note that many airlines charge a fee for correcting data on flight tickets, which will be passed on to the customer unless the error was made by  ZüriCar GmbH.
general.p2.5: The contract between the customer and the respective service provider is only concluded when the requested services are confirmed to the customer in a legally binding manner, either by the service provider or by  ZüriCar GmbH on behalf of the service provider.
general.h3: II. Brokerage and Processing Fees, Expenses
general.p3.1: ZüriCar GmbH (hereinafter referred to as  ZüriCar GmbH) does not charge a separate fee for brokerage services with regard to (only) hotels, package tours, rental cars, city trips and travel insurance, unless otherwise stipulated below:
general.p3.2: Brokerage fees are charged for brokerage services with regard to (only) flights, rail services and other individual services. The amount of the respective brokerage fee is shown in the corresponding offer within the booking mask and is clearly visible to the customer before the booking is completed
general.p3.3: Any expenses or expenses incurred by  ZüriCar GmbH in connection with the placement of the agency (e.g., costs for issuing visas, shipping fees, etc.) shall be reimbursed by the Customer to  ZüriCar GmbH in addition to the agency fee, which only covers the agency service.
general.p3.4: If  ZüriCar GmbH cancels the mediated service on behalf of the customer at the request of the respective service provider, a processing fee of CHF 50.00 per person/per ticket will be charged. The customer is free to declare a cancellation directly to the service provider. Any fees charged by the service provider in the context of the cancellation remain unaffected.
general.p3.5: A processing fee of CHF 80.00 will be charged for the preparation of a group offer. This fee is waived when the group offer is subsequently booked and will be credited to the customer by  ZüriCar GmbH in this case.
general.p3.6: All taxable brokerage and processing fees are inclusive of statutory value added tax.
general.p3.7: Should the customer rebook or cancel booked trips or services,  ZüriCar GmbH' claim to agency fees already incurred remains unaffected. This does not apply if the rebooking or cancellation is due to a defect in  ZüriCar GmbH' mediation or consulting services.
general.p4: ZüriCar GmbH (hereinafter referred to as  ZüriCar GmbH) shall provide the customer with the information required by law in accordance with Art. 6 of the Federal Act on Package Travel (Package Travel Act, PRG) to the extent required by law before the customer submits his contractual declaration. In the case of a telephone contract for a package tour, this information will be communicated to the customer by telephone.
general.p4.1: ZüriCar GmbH also fulfils the statutory obligation to provide prior contractual information. This includes in particular information on:
general.l4: the essential characteristics of the travel services offered,
general.l4.1: Name and address of the branch as well as telephone number and, if applicable, e-mail address of the respective tour operator,
general.l4.2: the tour price including taxes and, if applicable, any additional fees, charges and other costs,
general.p5: This information will be made available to the customer to the extent provided for by law, provided that it is relevant to the package in question.
general.p5.1: In the case of the provision of information and information that goes beyond the statutory information obligations,  ZüriCar GmbH shall only be liable within the scope of the statutory provisions for the careful selection of the sources of information and the correct and complete disclosure of the information to the customer.
general.p6: The following provisions apply generally to the payment of the travel price. For instalment payment transactions via third-party providers (e.g. Payrexx AG), the special contractual terms and conditions of this provider shall apply in addition. If these contradict the General Terms and Conditions of Payment, the special conditions of the respective provider shall take precedence in the case of instalment payment transactions. general.p6.1: The option is only available on participating online booking portals.
general.p6.2: Payments on the travel price may be made after conclusion of the contract in accordance with the agreed terms of payment. Upon conclusion of the contract, a deposit of the travel price is due immediately. This is usually as follows:
general.l6.1: 30% for flight packages or combined services,
general.p7: The final payment is due no later than 30 days before the start of the trip, unless otherwise agreed.
general.p7.1: For short trips with a duration of less than 24 hours without an overnight stay and a total price of less than CHF 100, the full travel price can be made due immediately.
general.p7.2: If the due deposit or final payment is not received by the due date,  ZüriCar GmbH is entitled to withdraw from the contract and charge a cancellation fee in accordance with section VI.
general.p7.3: If the tour operator incurs additional expenses due to late payments or missing documents (e.g. depositing tickets at the airport or reissuing them at the airport), it can charge the customer for the external costs incurred for this as well as a flat-rate processing fee of CHF 50 per transaction. Proof of lesser damage is reserved for the customer.
general.p7.4: Payment shall be made to  ZüriCar GmbH or to the respective service provider designated by  ZüriCar GmbH in the booking confirmation.
general.p7.5: If travel documents are delivered by express delivery at the customer's request or due to short-term bookings, the additional costs incurred for this will be passed on to the customer. The customer will be informed of the amount of the fees in advance.
general.p7.8: SEPA basic direct debit: If the customer chooses the SEPA direct debit method, the deposit will be debited 2 banking days after the contract has been confirmed. The balance is due 30 days before departure and charged 1 banking day thereafter. Chargeback costs are at the expense of the customer, unless the chargeback was caused by ZüriCar GmbH.
general.p7.9: Cash payment at the airport: If payment is made at the airport upon departure, it may be necessary to deposit or issue flight tickets or other travel documents. In this case, the organiser may charge additional processing fees and third-party costs of CHF 50 per booking.
general.p7.10: Incorrect age information for children's discounts: In the event of incorrect age information, the tour operator is entitled to claim the difference to the correct travel price. A flat-rate processing fee of CHF 50 may be charged for the additional processing effort. The customer can prove that no or less damage has occurred. Service providers such as airlines or hotels can also make a price adjustment.
general.p7.11: Reminder in the event of late payment: If the customer fails to make a payment due on time, ZüriCar GmbH may charge a reminder fee of CHF 40 per reminder. Further legal steps, in particular the assertion of default interest in accordance with Art. 104 CO (currently 5% p.a.), are reserved. The customer has the option of proving that no or less damage has occurred.
general.p8: The services listed in the booking confirmation are decisive as described on info@zuricar.ch. We reserve the right to make changes before the conclusion of the contract.
general.p8.1: Flight times, routing or aircraft may be changed. The regulations according to section 4 apply.
general.p8.3: Processing of empty weeks possible on request, processing fee: CHF 50 per person/week.
general.p8.4: Children's discounts are based on age at the start of the trip. Children under the age of two travel without the right to a seat if accompanied by an accompanying adult.
general.p9: Changes to individual services are permissible if they are insignificant and do not affect the overall structure.
general.p9.1: Deficiencies remain complainable even in the case of changed services.
general.p9.2: The customer will be informed of any changes without delay. In the event of significant changes, the customer will have the right to rebook or withdraw free of charge.
general.p9.3: In the event of significant changes, the customer can withdraw free of charge or request an equivalent trip.
general.l10: Travel documents that ZüriCar GmbH (hereinafter referred to as  ZüriCar GmbH) receives from tour operators or other service providers for forwarding to the customer will be sent to the customer by e-mail or post. In individual cases, the documents may be deposited at an airport counter; the relevant information will be communicated to the customer in a timely manner.
general.l10.1: In the case of car rental bookings, the corresponding vouchers will be sent to the customer either by e-mail, fax or post. Alternatively, the customer can only be given the reservation number, which he must show to the respective rental car company when he takes over the vehicle.
general.l10.2: If the delivery of travel documents by courier service has been expressly agreed with the customer, the customer shall bear the costs incurred for this in full.
general.l10.3: When taking out travel insurance, the customer will receive the insurance number and the complete insurance conditions by e-mail. These documents together are considered complete insurance documents.
general.l10.4: In his own interest, the customer is requested to check all documents submitted to him immediately for correctness and completeness. Any discrepancies must be reported to  ZüriCar GmbH immediately in order to avoid possible damage or disadvantages.
general.l11.1: The liability of ZüriCar GmbH as a travel agent for damages that are not based on injury to life, limb or health is limited to the foreseeable damage typical for the contract and amounts to a maximum of the total price of the arranged trip or travel service attributable to the person concerned in the individual case. This limitation of liability does not apply in the event of intentional or grossly negligent conduct or in the event of a breach of essential contractual obligations, the fulfilment of which is essential for the proper execution of the contract and on the compliance with which the customer may regularly rely.
general.l11.2: The above limitation of liability does not apply in the case of mandatory statutory liability, in particular under the Product Liability Act (PrHG) or in the case of guarantees or assurances assumed.
general.l12: Unless expressly stated otherwise, ZüriCar GmbH (hereinafter referred to as “ ZüriCar GmbH”) assumes that the customer and all travel participants registered by them are Swiss citizens. If this is not the case, the customer is obliged to inform  ZüriCar GmbH in a timely and complete manner of any different nationalities.
general.l12.1: Compliance with the applicable entry, passport, visa, customs, health, and vaccination regulations in the transit and destination countries is the sole responsibility of the travel participant. This also includes the timely procurement of all necessary travel documents as well as the fulfillment of health requirements such as vaccinations or test certificates.
general.l12.2: If  ZüriCar GmbH is expressly instructed to obtain visas or other travel documents,  ZüriCar GmbH is not liable for the timely issuance or delivery of these documents, unless there is its own fault in the sense of intent or gross negligence.
general.l12.3: It is strongly recommended that all participants in the journey obtain information at an early stage about infection and vaccination protection, other prophylactic measures, and potential health risks—especially on long-haul flights with regard to thrombosis risks—from a specialist or from the competent cantonal health authority.
general.l13.1: ZüriCar GmbH strongly recommends that you ensure you have sufficient international health insurance coverage before you travel. In addition, it is advisable to take out a comprehensive travel protection package or at least travel cancellation insurance as well as insurance to cover repatriation costs in the event of accident, illness, or death. Customers are expressly referred to corresponding offers from travel insurance companies.
general.l13.2: If the customer has cause for complaint in connection with travel insurance brokered by  ZüriCar GmbH, they can contact the respective insurer. If no satisfactory solution is reached, it is possible to turn to the following independent body:
general.l15.1: The customer is informed that the general terms and conditions of the service providers named in the respective service description (e.g. airlines, hotels, rental car providers) may give rise to additional or special obligations for the customer. It is the Client's responsibility to familiarize themselves with these Terms and to ensure that they are complied with.
general.l15.2: Particularly in the case of air travel, the information provided on flight tickets or electronic booking confirmations must be observed. These include, in particular, compliance with the specified check-in times and, in the case of special and charter flights, the obligation to reconfirm outbound, return or onward flights within the deadline set by the airline. Failure to reconfirm this can lead to the loss of the right to transport.
general.l15.3: In the event of loss of baggage, baggage delay or damage, a Property Irregularity Report (PIR) must be submitted directly to the relevant airline at the airport in accordance with the applicable national and international aviation regulations (e.g. the Montreal Convention). A subsequent notification can lead to the complete loss of compensation claims.
general.h16: X. Identity of the operating airline in the case of booked flight services
general.p16: ZüriCar GmbH points out that the customer will be informed of the identity of the operating airline for all air carriage booked as part of the package tour or individual service – provided that the airline has already been determined before the conclusion of the contract. The corresponding information can be found in the respective service description.
general.p16.1: If the operating airline is not yet known at the time the contract is concluded, the customer will be informed of the expected operating airline. As soon as the final airline has been determined, ZüriCar GmbH will inform the customer immediately. The same applies in the event of a later change of the operating airline.
general.p16.2: This information is provided in accordance with the applicable provisions of the bilateral air services agreement between Switzerland and the European Union.
general.h17: XI. Reduction of the Limitation Period
general.p17.1: Claims of the customer against ZüriCar GmbH arising from the agency contract shall become statute-barred within one year, to the extent legally permissible, in deviation from the statutory provisions. Excluded from this are claims for damages resulting from injury to life, limb or health as well as those based on an intentional or grossly negligent breach of duty by ZüriCar GmbH or its legal representatives or vicarious agents. In these cases, the statutory limitation periods in accordance with the Code of Obligations (CO) apply.
general.p17.2: The limitation period shall commence at the end of the calendar year in which the claim arose and the customer became aware of the circumstances giving rise to the claim and the person of the debtor, or should have become aware of them without gross negligence.
general.h18: XII. Consumer Dispute Resolution / Online Dispute Resolution
general.p18.1: ZüriCar GmbH is neither obliged nor willing to participate in dispute resolution proceedings before a state-recognized consumer arbitration board.
general.p18.2: If the customer is resident in an EU member state, ZüriCar GmbH refers to the platform for online dispute resolution (ODR platform) of the European Commission, which can be reached at http://ec.europa.eu/consumers/odr. This platform is used for the out-of-court settlement of disputes arising from online service contracts between consumers and companies based in the EU. Swiss companies are not obliged to participate in this procedure.
general.p19: Swiss law shall apply exclusively. The application of the Vienna Convention on Contracts for the International Sale of Goods (UN Sales Law) is excluded.
